title: Team Katarina

moderator: Grace Teo, Open Style Lab, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, MIT

segmentation: Team Katarina over there and Katarina had two different issues and so I'm going to go through them pretty quickly.
The first one was apensen, so Katarina actually uses a urine bag.

As you can see here, which attaches to the side of her leg most of the time, and this means that when she wears certain pens it becomes too tight because the urine bag is there in the lower legs and then some pens are is just makes it difficult to access the urine bag which needs to be changed out every three to five hours and emptied and then again for depends because of the sitting position.
The material will bunch up in the front door.
It's too short in the back.
And then if you can imagine as well because you're in a sitting position, the amount of fabric over the knee becomes stretched.
It becomes too tight, and so most of the time Katerina had to wear sweatpants.
So what the team was trying to do was to create something aesthetically pleasing, comfortable, high under Beck, fits well around the knee, and will allow for easy access to the urine bag.
So here's the final solution you came up with.
It's really elegant piece of work, so Katarina wanted something that looked like jeans and then they also put in this high back end or front as you can see here.
And then they decide wrinkles at the side of the knee.
You can see it actually made here, which would allow for more fabric to go over the knee so it fit.
Better.

In addition, they put a long zipper in the lower leg so you could open it up to access to urine bag very quickly in the initial sketch, I think they were thinking about putting a little pocket in the side of the pens as well to hold the urine bag, but eventually I realized that the Velcro for the urine bag that usually attaches urine bag to katarina's leg worked well enough so they didn't put in the pocket in the end.
But here's the zipper.
And finally they found this very soft, stretchy material that looked like denim, and so that also made it really comfortable.
So at the end they were very very successful in making something that was attractive, comfortable, high in the back.
Sorry, that 4th metric is shouldn't be there an it was allowed for Katarina to have easy access to urine bag, so that was the first project.
The second project was a lot more complex and it was for Katarina to be able to put on and take off a jacket by herself.
So Katarina does still have some function in the upper part of her body, but not alot.
She isn't able to use her fingers too well.
And so it makes putting on and taking off a jacket difficult.
You should issue as a personal assistant to help her.
Also, she can still drive wheelchair with the joystick, so she needed to make sure that the sleeves were not so long that it prevented her from using the joystick on a wheelchair.
And so sometimes when she bought jackets with sleeves that were the right length, the shoulder width would become too small and so that will make it very difficult for dressing.
So she needed something that would balance well between the length of the sleeve and the width of the shoulder.
And then again the jacket needed to be cut for the sitting position.
Right so.
Those were the success metrics the team came up with.
As you can see, there were a lot of them.
It was a complex problem.
And so it's really impressive what they've been able to come up with.
So here's the final jacket.
You can see it's black, purple and pink, which are all katarina's favorite colors.
The team managed to find a very beautiful wool is a natural wool.
That purple layer in there is a natural wool, so it's very soft, very comfortable and very warm, and is also very thin.
Sorta.
Jacket didn't become too bulky and made it easier to be put on.
And also it's cut for the sitting position, so is shorter in front and longer behind, but a few of the I'm going to go through the most interesting features in this jacket.
The first one is that they put in a zipper in the front of the jacket.
We actually brought it over from America with.
